title: Green quinoa breakfast bowl

ingredients.content: 80 g frozen edamame beans, defrosted and shelled (see Tips)
extra virgin olive oil, for drizzling
1 lemon or lime, cut into cheeks to serve (optional)

preparations.content: Place Varoma dish into position and place asparagus into it. Insert Varoma tray and weigh peas and edamame beans onto it. Set Varoma aside.
Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh quinoa into it, then cook <b>15 min/100Â°C/speed 4<b>.

Place Varoma with vegetables into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 4<b> or until quinoa and vegetables are cooked to your liking. Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula.

Divide quinoa between serving bowls and top with cooked vegetables, spinach, zucchini and spring onions/shallots. Top with a poached egg and feta, then sprinkle with pistachios and dukkah. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with micro herbs (optional) and serve with lemon or lime cheeks (optional).

hintsAndTricks: If you're buying edamame beans in pods, you will need approx. 150 g beans. Once steamed, you can remove them from their pods.
This breakfast bowl can also be served to the whole family. Just be sure to chop all ingredients as needed for younger children (and omit or go easy with the feta which is typically high in salt).
To poach eggs, please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook or to the Poached eggs with hollandaise sauce recipe on this recipe chip.
